title: Bathurst 1000: Property on Mount Panorama’s Conrod Straight up for sale
text:
A luxury property located on Mount Panorama’s Conrod Straight has hit the market, providing Australian motorsport fans with a once in lifetime opportunity.

The 36 hectare property at 448 Conrod Straight, Mount Panorama, named Lochinvar, features 288m of track frontage along Conrod Straight, giving potential buyers a front-row seat to the Bathurst 1000.

Insane home has underground squash court

It is the largest privately-held block of land on Mount Panorama and features 24-hour unrestricted access to the property, even during events.

The property has one permanent main residence and three brick veneer luxury cottages used for accommodation, as well as a shed complex.

It also features a workshop and mower shed.

This is the first time the property has been listed in 33 years.

Mount Panorama is the home venue for the annual Bathurst 1000, as well as many other motorsport events.

Ray White Emms Mooney agent Louise Ireland said the current owners plan to stay in Bathurst once the property is sold and enjoy their retirement, adding there is nothing like the property for sale anywhere on the track.

“If you miss out you miss out … it truly is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity and there is nothing like this property on or near the track,” she said.

“There is huge hospitality development potential … you can build a tourist park or caravan park and all that is permissible with DA approval.”

“Some pretty prominent racing teams have stayed on the property over the years — you might even be able to sleep in the room that they once did.”

It has operated as a Bed and Breakfast for the last 22 years and goes under the hammer on Friday, November 22 at 10.30am.
description: A dream come true for every Australian motorsport fan, this home for sale on Mount Panorama’s Conrod Straight will let you watch the Bathurst 1000 from your own backyard.
